content.text:
Here is my attempt at the task, following the specified output format:

Involving Parents and Older Students to Facilitate Complex Play

1. Recruit parent volunteers to lead small group activities - Have parents sign up to assist with specific activities like art projects, science experiments, or storytelling - Train parent volunteers on facilitating the activities and guiding children's engagement 2. Partner older students with younger children for joint activities - Pair an older student "buddy" with each younger child - Have the older students help the younger children follow instructions and stay focused on the activity - Encourage the older students to ask the younger children questions to extend their thinking 3. Plan activities that allow for different roles and levels of complexity - Choose activities that can be adapted for different skill levels - Assign parent volunteers and older students to work with children who need more support - Provide extension ideas for children who finish the main activity quickly 4. Debrief with volunteers after the activities - Get feedback from parents and older students on what worked well and what could be improved - Discuss specific strategies that were effective for engaging the children in focused, complex play - Thank the volunteers for their time and contributions
